org.gatein.api.common

Class Attributes

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • java.util.HashMap<String,String>
        • org.gatein.api.common.Attributes
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Map<String,String>

    public class Attributes
extends HashMap<String,String>
implements Serializable
    Implements Map and adds convinience methods to retrieve a String property converted into a specific type. The get(Key), put(Key, Object) and remove(Key) methods converts String values to/from the instances of the class specified by Attributes.Key.type.
    Author:
    Nick Scavelli, Stian Thorgersen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        AbstractMap.SimpleEntry<K,V>, AbstractMap.SimpleImmutableEntry<K,V>

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Attributes()
      Creates a new attributes instance with no attributes
      Attributes(Map<String,String> values)
      Creates a new attributes instance and adds all attributes from the specified map

    • Constructor Detail

      • Attributes

        public Attributes()
        Creates a new attributes instance with no attributes

      • Attributes

        public Attributes(Map<String,String> values)
        Creates a new attributes instance and adds all attributes from the specified map
        Parameters:
        values - the map of attributes to add

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public <T> T get(Attributes.Key<T> key)
        Returns the value to the which the specified key name is mapped. The value is returned as the type specified by the key type
        Parameters:
        key - the key for the attribute
        Returns:
        the converted value
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified key is null, or the value failed to convert into to key type

      • put

        public <T> T put(Attributes.Key<T> key,
        T value)
        Converts the value into a String using the toString method
        Parameters:
        key - the key for the attribute
        value - the value
        Returns:
        the previous value, or null if it didn't exist
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified key is null, the current value is non-null and failed to convert into the key type, or the value class is not the same as the key type

      • remove

        public <T> T remove(Attributes.Key<T> key)
        Removes the attribute that is mapped to the specified key name
        Parameters:
        key - the key for the the attribute
        Returns:
        the previous value, or null if it didn't exist
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified key is null, or the current value is non-null and failed to to convert into the key type

      • key

        public static <T> Attributes.Key<T> key(String name,
                        Class<T> type)
        Creates a key with the specified name and type. The type class has to either be String or implement a static method valueOf(String) method as specified in get(Key). The valueOf method should convert the string parameter into an instance of type and return it.
        Parameters:
        name - the key name
        type - the key type
        Returns:
        the key
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if name or type is null, or if type is not String or does not implement the static valueOf method
